text: The normal site css should be added when you preview global groups in design manager. Otherwise, all you see if everything in plain text without styling. For example, having a global group used for the footer of your template. Any changes you decide to make in the footer in the future will not show with the proper css/styling. This makes it really hard to layout the content in that global group.
Even better: attach style files (as we do for templates). Then if you use a global module in a template it can be automatically attached (if needed).

to basically add that in for previews of the global group?
Yeah that might work. IF the request.domain gets injected into that module.
Because the URL is not read from teh browser but the json feed that it is output into.

I would love it if there was a way to re-label modules/custom modules once added to a flexible column.  I regularly build "Meet the Team" pages for clients using a template with a flexible column that has a bunch of the same "team member" custom module added to it.  re-ordering/editing gets a little confusing once there are many of the same module in a flexible column.
